dcterms:creator: B. T. Gallo
C. K. Potvin
P. S. Skinner
H. E. Brooks
E. Rasmussen
dcterms:description: The WoF System (WoFS) ensemble forecasts provide rapidly updating probabilistic guidance for short-term severe weather forecasts, available every 5 minutes out to 150 minutes of lead time.
dcterms:title: WoF System (WoFS) ensemble forecasts

dcterms:creator: B. T. Gallo
C. K. Potvin
P. S. Skinner
H. E. Brooks
E. Rasmussen
dcterms:description: The 2017-2019 NOAA Hazardous Weather Testbed Spring Forecasting Experiments (HWT-SFE) dataset includes ensemble forecasts used to evaluate severe weather prediction methods.
dcterms:title: 2017-2019 NOAA Hazardous Weather Testbed Spring Forecasting Experiments (HWT-SFE)

dcterms:creator: C. K. Potvin
C. Broyles
P. S. Skinner
H. E. Brooks
E. Rasmussen
dcterms:description: Local Storm Reports (LSR) provide a database of reported severe weather events, which are used for verification and analysis in severe weather forecasting.
dcterms:title: Local Storm Reports (LSR)

dcterms:creator: R. D. Adams-Selin
C. L. Ziegler
dcterms:description: WRF-HAILCAST is a model used for forecasting hail, utilizing a one-dimensional hail growth model within the WRF framework.
dcterms:title: WRF-HAILCAST

dcterms:creator: D. Dowell
Coauthors
dcterms:description: The Experimental 3-km High-Resolution Rapid Refresh Ensemble (HRRRE) is designed for severe weather forecasting, providing high-resolution ensemble forecasts.
dcterms:title: Experimental 3-km High-Resolution Rapid Refresh Ensemble (HRRRE)
